Fluorometric results were expressed as mean ± SD. Statistical significance was analyzed by two-way ANOVA using GraphPad Prism, version 7, as specified in the figure legends. K m determinations were obtained by plotting the velocity of the reaction as a function of nucleotide or ssRNA template concentrations using nonlinear regression. IC 50 values were obtained by fitting the velocity data to a four-parameter logistic equation. Kinetic parameters and IC 50 values were calculated using Sigmaplot, version 11. Z’ factor was calculated according to Zhang et al.
39 : Z’ = 1 − [(3SD c+ + 3SD c−)/(mean c+ − mean c−)] where “c+” is the activity obtained in a standard assay and “c−” is the nonspecific activity obtained in a control performed in the absence of MnCl 2.
